intro: Pearcea reticulata, commonly known as the reticulate pearcea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its delicate, hairy leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a warm, humid climate to flourish. Pearcea reticulata is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
